metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6060 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The get_option function in dhcpcd 4.0.0 through 6.x before 6.4.3 allowsremote DHCP servers to cause a denial of service by resetting theDHO_OPTIONSOVERLOADED option in the (1) bootfile or (2) servername section,which triggers the option to be processed again.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6060` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dhcpcd5 - 6.0.5-2build0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: dhcpcd5 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.5-2build0.14.04.1').
